in 1994 seven years in prison i was sent
to a work center in altus oklahoma i was
assigned to a cemetery job where i
tended to the upkeep of the burial sites
new and old
this was a small country town which had
two separate cemeteries that sat across
from each other the small one was for
blacks and the big one was for whites
that died during the segregation days
but now everyone was being buried in the
big cemetery
some of these tombstones were dated as
far back as the 1500s
i would ride around on my four-wheeler
reading the names and dates on the
tombstones in the old section of the
cemetery
i've always had a curiosity and an
infatuation with death since i was a
small child but that's another story
entirely
one day i stopped at five old tombstones
that this huge huge very huge oak tree
hovered over them almost like it was
providing shelter from the elements of
mother nature
on the small dirt road i got off the
four-wheeler to get a closer look
all were dated back to the mid-1500s
there were two big tombstones and three
little ones after carefully reading each
one i realized it was a family of five
and they all died on exactly the same
day
i stood there a moment and tried to
guess what happened to this family
hundreds of years ago were they murdered
did one of their parents do it and then
killed themselves was it a house fire
was a disease of some kind
whoever or whatever ended this family's
lives is a tragic story as i stood there
hold on as i stood there lost in
emotions a strange feeling came over me
as if i was being watched i immediately
turned around to survey my surroundings
that strange feeling was quickly
replaced with a really bad feeling
i turned and jumped on my four-wheeler
four-wheeler and like vin diesel in the
fast and the furious i peeled off and
cut the corner on two wheels
now prior to this job i hated it because

it was becoming too much for me to

i was constantly depressed i dreaded
